results.title: Compilation: big brown beastie big brown face
results.brief_description: Big brown beastie, big brown face (Aust., prod., dir. Robert Talbot): Film about Bill Roycroft, world famous Australian horseman. “Ponies of Miklaengi” (U.S., prod. Daniel Smith ; dir. Gary Templeton): Two youngsters on horses round up sheep in Iceland. “So you want to own a pony” (Sydney, prod., dir. Robert Talbot): Explains the role of the Pony Club in helping owners with their first pony.

results.title: Compilation: anyway what is an Australian?
results.brief_description: Anyway…what is an Australian? (Melb., dir. Barbara Boyd; exec. prod. Ross Campbell): Views the concept of multiculturalism through the eyes of several new Australians in Melbourne. “Arrivederci Roma” (Melb., dir. Geoffrey Wright; prod. Richard Zatorski): A new Australian student comes to grips with his first swimming lesson. “Minh: a Vietnamese” (Sydney): A look at the life of a Vietnamese refugee in Australia.

results.title: Just Part Of the Job
results.creator_credit: Evan Keddie, Kim Windsor and Victorian Unemployed Workers' Union
results.brief_description: Designed to stimulate discussion regarding sexual harassment. Shows a school leaver and her efforts to find a job. Presents the difficult situation she finds herself in when she is subject to a rather subtle form of sexual harassment in an employment interview.

results.title: Touch wood: five Tasmanian woodworkers
results.brief_description: About five men who live in Tasmania and earn their living by working with wood. David Ralph makes small souvenir animals and furniture from horizontal wood; Kevin Perkins makes furniture which allows the natural shape of the wood to be shown; Merv Gray and Peter Mevre make bowls and spheres, and Peter Taylor sculptural pieces.

results.title: Neon
results.creator_credit: Salik Silverstein, Alex Proyas and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A single-frame time-lapse journey through Sydney, the surrealistic city. Figures dart in and out of the shadows of the night. A kaleidoscope of imagery flies by - incorporates people in subways, cars on freeways, city streets and buildings. The music (by Fad Gadget) drives the images to a tumultuous climax.

results.title: The Repco-Brabham story
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson and Cine Service Production
results.brief_description: Briefly shows manufacture and testing of racing cars by the Brabham Racing Organisation in England, followed by views of the 1965 Tasman Series motor races in Australia and New Zealand, Jack Brabham and others competing in Brabham cars. Finally, manufacture of a new Repco engine in Australia is shown.

Finally, manufacture of a new Repco engine in Australia is shown.

results.title: The Rigid Heddle Frame
results.creator_credit: Ken J. Widdowson, John Gray and Educational Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Weaving”.
An instructional film on weaving for both beginners and more advanced weavers. In the rigid heddle frame, warp threads are passed through a slotted, wooden heddle instead of being attached to moving cords. Additional credits: photographer: Alan Grice ; script: Kay Donald ; editor: David Corke ; weaver and adviser: Erika Semler.

results.title: Nippers, chompers, grinders
results.creator_credit: Judy Nelson and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A film on dental hygiene for children ages 5-8. Janis, who refuses to brush her teeth, disappears down the plughole in order to escape that boring task. She meets three monsters, Nippers, Chompers and Grinders, each with specific tooth ailments and helps them overcome their disabilities. Voices: Valma Bolton, Colin Van Cao, Evelyn Krape, Stephen Radic, Claire Dobbin.

results.title: Hot glass
results.creator_credit: John Tchalenko and National Film School (Great Britain)
results.brief_description: Several expert glass makers demonstrate their skills and techniques. Includes Simon Pearce, Fred Daden, Wilki Adolpson, Dale Chihuly, Jamie Carpenter and Gianni Toss.
